ETYMOLOGY: From 'post' (meaning mail or postal service) + 'card' (meaning a small, stiff piece of paper). First used as 'postal card'.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A card, often with a picture on one side, that can be sent through the mail without an envelope.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: （背面有图片或照片的）明信片，风景明信片；可在邮局邮寄而不需信封的卡片。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: I bought a beautiful postcard of the Eiffel Tower to send to my friends.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我买了一张漂亮的埃菲尔铁塔明信片寄给我的朋友们。
